Definition at line 116 of file Dynamixel2Arduino.cpp.

◆ Dynamixel2Arduino() [2/2]

Dynamixel2Arduino::Dynamixel2Arduino ( HardwareSerial &  port,
int  dir_pin = -1,
uint16_t  packet_buf_size = DEFAULT_DXL_BUF_LENGTH 
)

The constructor.

const int DXL_DIR_PIN = 2;
Dynamixel2Arduino dxl(Serial1, DXL_DIR_PIN);
Parameters
portThe HardwareSerial port you want to use on the board to communicate with DYNAMIXELs. It is automatically initialized baudrate to 57600 by calling the begin () function.
dir_pinDirectional pins for using half-duplex communication. -1 uses full duplex. (default : -1)

Definition at line 122 of file Dynamixel2Arduino.cpp.

Member Function Documentation

◆ begin()

void Dynamixel2Arduino::begin ( unsigned long  baud = 57600)

Initialization function to start communication with DYNAMIXEL. Or change baudrate of baud serial port.

const int DXL_DIR_PIN = 2;
Dynamixel2Arduino dxl(Serial1, DXL_DIR_PIN);
dxl.begin(57600);
Parameters
baudThe port speed you want on the board (the speed to communicate with DYNAMIXEL) (default : 57600)
Returns
It returns true(1) on success, false(0) on failure.

Definition at line 131 of file Dynamixel2Arduino.cpp.

◆ getModelNumber()

uint16_t Dynamixel2Arduino::getModelNumber ( uint8_t  id)

It is API for getting model number of DYNAMIXEL.

const int DXL_DIR_PIN = 2;
Dynamixel2Arduino dxl(Serial1, DXL_DIR_PIN);
Serial.print(dxl.getModelNumber(1));
Parameters
idDYNAMIXEL Actuator's ID.
Returns
It returns the data read from DXL control table item. If the read fails, 0xFFFF is returned.

◆ getPortBaud()

unsigned long Dynamixel2Arduino::getPortBaud ( )

It is API for getting serial baudrate of board port.

const int DXL_DIR_PIN = 2;
Dynamixel2Arduino dxl(Serial1, DXL_DIR_PIN);
Serial.print(dxl.getPortBaud());
Returns
It returns serial baudrate of board port.

Definition at line 143 of file Dynamixel2Arduino.cpp.

◆ getPresentCurrent()

float Dynamixel2Arduino::getPresentCurrent ( uint8_t  id,
uint8_t  unit = UNIT_RAW 
)

It is API for getting present current of DYNAMIXEL. You can use the @unit parameter to specify the unit of @value.

const int DXL_DIR_PIN = 2;
Dynamixel2Arduino dxl(Serial1, DXL_DIR_PIN);
Serial.print(dxl.getPresentCurrent(1));
Parameters
idDYNAMIXEL Actuator's ID.
unitThe unit you want to return (the function converts the raw value to the unit you specified and returns it) (default : UNIT_RAW) Only support UNIT_RAW, UNIT_PERCENT, UNIT_MILLI_AMPERE.
Returns
It returns the data read from DXL control table item.(Returns the value appropriate for @unit.) If the read fails, 0 is returned. Whether or not this is an actual value can be confirmed with @getLastLibErrCode().

Definition at line 822 of file Dynamixel2Arduino.cpp.

◆ getPresentPosition()

float Dynamixel2Arduino::getPresentPosition ( uint8_t  id,
uint8_t  unit = UNIT_RAW 
)

It is API for getting present position (joint) of DYNAMIXEL. You can use the @unit parameter to specify the unit of @value.

const int DXL_DIR_PIN = 2;
Dynamixel2Arduino dxl(Serial1, DXL_DIR_PIN);
Serial.print(dxl.getPresentPosition(1));
Parameters
idDYNAMIXEL Actuator's ID.
unitThe unit you want to return (the function converts the raw value to the unit you specified and returns it) (default : UNIT_RAW) Only support UNIT_RAW, UNIT_DEGREE.
Returns
It returns the data read from DXL control table item.(Returns the value appropriate for @unit.) If the read fails, 0 is returned. Whether or not this is an actual value can be confirmed with @getLastLibErrCode().

Definition at line 790 of file Dynamixel2Arduino.cpp.

◆ getTorqueEnableStat()

bool Dynamixel2Arduino::getTorqueEnableStat ( uint8_t  id)

It is API for getting the torque enabled / disabled status of DYNAMIXEL.

const int DXL_DIR_PIN = 2;
Dynamixel2Arduino dxl(Serial1, DXL_DIR_PIN);
Serial.print(dxl.getTorqueEnableStat(1));
Parameters
idDYNAMIXEL Actuator's ID.
Returns
It returns the Torque Enable data read from DXL control table item. If the Torque is On, true(1) is returned. Otherwise false(0) is returned.

Definition at line 890 of file Dynamixel2Arduino.cpp.

◆ readControlTableItem() [2/2]

int32_t Dynamixel2Arduino::readControlTableItem ( uint8_t  item_idx,
uint8_t  id,
uint32_t  timeout = 100 
)

It is API for getting data of a DYNAMIXEL control table item.

const int DXL_DIR_PIN = 2;
Dynamixel2Arduino dxl(Serial1, DXL_DIR_PIN);
Serial.print(dxl.readControlTableItem(PRESENT_VOLTAGE, 1));
Parameters
item_idxDYNAMIXEL Actuator's control table item's index. For each index, replace the name of the control table item in the e-manual with capital letters and replace the space with an underscore (_). For the list of indexes, please refer to the link below. TODO: add link (It is defined as 'enum ControlTableItem' in actuator.h)
idDYNAMIXEL Actuator's ID.
timeoutA timeout waiting for a response to a data transfer.
Returns
It returns the data read from DXL control table item.(Returns the value appropriate for @unit.) If the read fails, 0 is returned. Whether or not this is an actual value can be confirmed with @getLastLibErrCode().

Definition at line 977 of file Dynamixel2Arduino.cpp.

◆ scan()

bool Dynamixel2Arduino::scan ( )

It is same as using the broadcast parameter(0xFE) of the ping function.

const int DXL_DIR_PIN = 2;
Dynamixel2Arduino dxl(Serial1, DXL_DIR_PIN);
dxl.scan();
Returns
If a dynamixel succeeds in pinging, it returns 1, and returns 0 if none succeeds.

Definition at line 155 of file Dynamixel2Arduino.cpp.

◆ setBaudrate()

bool Dynamixel2Arduino::setBaudrate ( uint8_t  id,
uint32_t  baudrate 
)

It is API for changing baudrate of DYNAMIXEL.

const int DXL_DIR_PIN = 2;
Dynamixel2Arduino dxl(Serial1, DXL_DIR_PIN);
dxl.setBaudrate(1, 57600);
Parameters
idDYNAMIXEL Actuator's ID.
baudrateDYNAMIXEL Actuator's baudrate value. (Refer to the control table of each actuator for supported values (e-manual))
Returns
It returns true(1) on success, false(0) on failure.

Definition at line 245 of file Dynamixel2Arduino.cpp.

◆ setGoalCurrent()

bool Dynamixel2Arduino::setGoalCurrent ( uint8_t  id,
float  value,
uint8_t  unit = UNIT_RAW 
)

It is API for controlling current of DYNAMIXEL. You can use the @unit parameter to specify the unit of @value.

const int DXL_DIR_PIN = 2;
Dynamixel2Arduino dxl(Serial1, DXL_DIR_PIN);
dxl.setGoalCurrent(1, 512);
Parameters
idDYNAMIXEL Actuator's ID.
valueThe value you want to set.
unitThe unit of the value you entered. (default : UNIT_RAW) Only support UNIT_RAW, UNIT_PERCENT, UNIT_MILLI_AMPERE.
Returns
It returns true(1) on success, false(0) on failure.

bool Dynamixel2Arduino::writeControlTableItem ( uint8_t  item_idx,
uint8_t  id,
int32_t  data,
uint32_t  timeout = 100 
)

It is API for controlling data of a DYNAMIXEL control table item.

const int DXL_DIR_PIN = 2;
Dynamixel2Arduino dxl(Serial1, DXL_DIR_PIN);
dxl.writeControlTableItem(TORQUE_ENABLE, 1, 1);
Parameters
item_idxDYNAMIXEL Actuator's control table item's index. For each index, replace the name of the control table item in the e-manual with capital letters and replace the space with an underscore (_). For the list of indexes, please refer to the link below. TODO: add link (It is defined as 'enum ControlTableItem' in actuator.h)
idDYNAMIXEL Actuator's ID.
dataThe data you want to write. Only the data size allowed by the address is applied.
timeoutA timeout waiting for a response to a data transfer.
Returns
It returns true(1) on success, false(0) on failure.
